page.title: 16HISTORY ROUND MONIFIETH
page.content:
The name{MONIFIETH}is spelt 32 ways (at least!)in official records."hill of deer" and "monks" may be origin.
The{LAWS}a green conical hill north of Ardownie has traces of a vitrified fort,turret-shaped and with spywindow Brochs are always near the sea with fertile lands around.Picts could with stand attack and defend it easily.Near by is a walled garden.Peacocks strut around.At{Woodhill Farm Ardestie}in 1857 and 1952 Bronze Age Cists were found.
{GRANGE CASTLE}the Durham family home for 400 years,was given to them by Sir Robert Bruce in 1332.John Knox visited the family.In 1829 it was knocked down Grange House built on the same spot was a Country Club till recently but is to be turned into flats.
